modules.name: Critical Thinking
modules.description: Analyze the problem from multiple perspectives to identify potential pitfalls and nuances.

modules.name: Step-by-Step Thinking
modules.description: Break down the problem into a sequence of small, manageable steps.

modules.name: Decomposition
modules.description: Divide a complex problem into smaller, independent sub-problems.

modules.name: Abstraction
modules.description: Identify general patterns or principles underlying the specific problem.

modules.name: Analogical Reasoning
modules.description: Find similarities with previously solved problems to apply successful strategies.

modules.name: Constraint Analysis
modules.description: Explicitly list and analyze all constraints and limitations defined in the problem.

modules.name: Hypothesis Generation
modules.description: Formulate multiple potential explanations or solutions before testing them.

modules.name: Verification/Self-correction
modules.description: Check intermediate results for errors and correct the approach if necessary.

modules.name: Pattern Recognition
modules.description: Identify recurring structures or sequences within the problem data.

modules.name: Information Retrieval
modules.description: Identify knowledge or data that needs to be recalled or retrieved to solve the problem.

modules.name: Creative Thinking
modules.description: Generate out-of-the-box ideas or unconventional approaches.

modules.name: Systems Thinking
modules.description: View the problem as a system of interacting parts and analyze their relationships.

modules.name: Causal Reasoning
modules.description: Determine cause-and-effect relationships between variables or events.

modules.name: Mathematical Modeling
modules.description: Translate the problem into mathematical equations or structures.

modules.name: Logic Programming
modules.description: Formulate the problem as a set of logical rules and facts.

modules.name: Algorithm Design
modules.description: Create a specific algorithm or procedure to solve the problem.

modules.name: Decision Matrix
modules.description: Evaluate multiple options against a set of weighted criteria.

modules.name: Risk Assessment
modules.description: Identify potential risks and their impact on the proposed solution.

modules.name: Resource Allocation
modules.description: Optimize the use of available resources (time, computation, memory).

modules.name: Game Theory
modules.description: Analyze the problem as a strategic interaction between rational agents.

modules.name: Historical Analysis
modules.description: Look at historical data or context to understand trends.

modules.name: Ethical Reasoning
modules.description: Consider ethical implications and moral principles.

modules.name: Emotional Intelligence
modules.description: Consider emotional aspects and human factors involved.

modules.name: Cultural Context
modules.description: Analyze the problem within a specific cultural framework.

modules.name: Linguistic Analysis
modules.description: Analyze the language, syntax, and semantics of the problem statement.

modules.name: Visual Reasoning
modules.description: Use visual aids, diagrams, or mental imagery to understand the problem.

modules.name: Simulation
modules.description: Simulate the process or system to observe its behavior under different conditions.

modules.name: Counterfactual Thinking
modules.description: Imagine 'what if' scenarios to understand dependencies and outcomes.

modules.name: First Principles
modules.description: Break the problem down to its most basic truths and build up from there.

modules.name: Socratic Questioning
modules.description: Ask probing questions to challenge assumptions and clarify the problem.

modules.name: Lateral Thinking
modules.description: Approach the problem from an indirect or unexpected angle.

modules.name: Backward Reasoning
modules.description: Start from the desired goal and work backwards to the current state.

modules.name: Divide and Conquer
modules.description: Recursively break down a problem into two or more sub-problems of the same or related type.

modules.name: Root Cause Analysis
modules.description: Identify the fundamental cause of a problem rather than just addressing symptoms.

modules.name: Gap Analysis
modules.description: Compare current state vs desired future state and determine how to bridge the gap.

modules.name: SWOT Analysis
modules.description: Analyze Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats.

modules.name: Cost-Benefit Analysis
modules.description: Weigh the benefits of a solution against its costs.

modules.name: Pareto Analysis
modules.description: Focus on the 20% of causes that produce 80% of the results (80/20 rule).

modules.name: Scientific Method
modules.description: Systematic observation, measurement, and experiment, and the formulation, testing, and modification of hypotheses.
